citation.article-title: Emendation of the genus Planococcus and transfer of Flavobacterium okeanokoites Zobell and Upham 1944 to the genus Planococcus as Planococcus okeanokoites comb. nov.

p.s: Emended description of the genus Planucoccus Migula 1894.

Cells are cocci that are 1.0 to 1.2 Î¼m in diameter and occur singly, in pairs, in threes, or in tetrads or are rods which are 0.4 to 0.8 pm wide and 1.0 to 20 pm long. Gram positive to gram variable. Motile. Motile cells possess several flagella. Spores are not formed. The color of the cell mass is yellow to orange. Chemoorganotrophs. Metabolism is respiratory. Aerobes. Catalase positive. Urease negative. Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite. Hydrolysis of esculin, starch, and Tween 80 is negative. The major isoprenoid quinones are MK-7 and MK-8. The cellular fatty acids are mainly branched fatty acids. The G+C content of the DNA is 39 to 52 mol%.
